feature.name: Fighter Archetype: Galkin (HB)
feature.text:
Legends and stories spoken by the great skalds speak of many divine beasts. The Galkin embodies their wild fury. They fight not just with the skill of a trained warrior but using the techniques of monsters. A Galkin's knowledge of mythic beasts makes them ideal at destroying them.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 38 (Third Party)

feature.name: Fenrir's Ire (Galkin (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at third level, when you critically hit with an attack, the target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw with a DC equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your strength modifier, or drop any weapons they are wielding.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 38 (Third Party)

feature.name: Slepnir's Swiftness (Galkin (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 6th level, you may take the dash action as a bonus action.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 38 (Third Party)

feature.name: Aesiric Companions (Galkin (HB))
feature.text:
At 10th level, gain one of the following features. You may replace this feature with a different feature whenever you gain a level in fighter.
Huginn and Muninn: When an allied creature attacks a target with advantage, you gain advantage against that target until the end of your next turn.
Geri and Freki: When an allied creature within 5 ft. of you is attacked by another creature within 5 ft. of you, you may use your reaction to make a single melee attack against the attacking creature.
Tanngrisnir and Tanngnjostr: Add your Constitution modifier to your death saving throws. If you succeed on your death saving throws and become stable, you may spend any number of hit dice to heal and regain consciousness.
Vanir Cats: Gain advantage on Dexterity saving throws against traps and spells that you can see. This ability does not work if you are blinded, deafened or incapacitated.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 38 (Third Party)

feature.name: Troll's Tenacity (Galkin (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 15th level, if you begin your turn with less than half of your hit points maximum, you regain a number of hit points equal to your Constitution modifier.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 38 (Third Party)

feature.name: Nidhogg's Hunger (Galkin (HB))
feature.text:
At 18th level, when you make an attack with a melee weapon, you may target all creatures within 5 ft. of you with the same attack roll.
Source: GM Toolkit Monthly - Legends of Norse Mythology p. 38 (Third Party)
